WUwjBODxR9Pdgjcl7IyWBg.text: Love the bright colors! Nice environment. Easy to order. We received our food fast! Staff is friendly, overall a great experience!! Would recommend to anyone!

gcT6KfzJPUQ9oVdNlsCdVQ.text: Ok folks, having lived in Texas for a few yrs, I did have the pleasure of having a vast array of ethnic foods available at any hour. Esp Dallas. They had a Fuzzys Taco restaurant as well. And, ya never know until you try them, ..rt?!  They were, eh, so so. Nothing like what you'd find on the streets in Deep Ellum! So my bestie and I thought we'd give the new Fuzzys at Sycamore Commons a try. Ill cut to the chase here in case your reading this in hast, before running out the door to try them. Read on before you start the car dear, First sign of a questionable establishment, a lot of empty tables. Yup. But it was still early, ok, we'll continue. service was, quick, waiter was cute,... the food..... The Order incorrect, sent it back very nicely, waiter still cute food still wrong. I got my Baja shrimp looking gud!!  Tasting like last week's fresh shrimp. So freaking dissapointed, then I tried my fish taco. OMGosh. It looks like hamburger. OMGosh, it was hamburger. At this point, not worth sending back. But I did get my 2.99 back.  Thanks Fuzzys, but, you just didn't cut tha ethinaticity of Mexican food.

_Z_G9spSUySxGc0ikdk5UQ.text: Very salty brisket - manager with an attitude-  Decent price for sit down fast food   They do offer a nice, little selection of beer

UUThXbVqmAbH6FA20knmtQ.text: Came on $1 taco day and despite the craziness, they still accommodated us and were so friendly at the bar! Shoutout to all the employees who had to work. And as always, the food was great. And the drinks were even better. Highly recommend.

jRlJAirDKvEWSh8KMrkkUA.text: To give this place a fair assessment we made two visits.  The place is roomy and the staff is very friendly.  The portions are small and the amount of protein (meat) in any dish even smaller.  Flavor is unremarkable.   A word of advise if you try it too:  1. Check your silverware closely.  On both visits we found numerous pieces of cutlery with food residue caked on.  Not 2 or 3 dirty items but more like 10.  One spoon was totally encrusted with refried beans.  We mentioned this to staff and they were very apologetic but we saw no one actually address the issue. 2.  Familiarize yourself with the item descriptions.  A management type person served our entrees and failed to include the tortillas and salsa that are part of the meal. It took me a moment to realize this and I went back and read the menu board to see if I was mistaken about what my order included.  I was not.  I can see a new server overlooking this but management ought to be more familiar.

O4TiqbtVqxMe4LRlkNUxOQ.text: Food was really good! Queso is amazing and the OREO churros absolutely made my entire life! Service was good once they figured out that the cashier gave me someone else's number for the table.

m6OPDm8UHYnPbU7K2kkr5g.text: We have been waiting for this place to open.  The quesadilla was good.  The garlic sauce set the taste apart from other places.  My daughter had the chicken nachos and said the chicken was seasoned well.  My husband got the grilled vegetable salad.  He was expecting grilled veggies but was told the carrots, black beans, tomatoes were the grilled veggies.  He'll try the fajita veggies next time.  That is the only reason for the 4 stars.  The grilled veggies was a little misleading.

SGXgHnwkq77wloG7PBh5Pw.text: Heard about the grand opening on the radio and went to check it out for lunch that afternoon. GREAT PLACE! Well priced food, speed of service was great, and delicious!! Will be going back for sure. Didn't visit the bar this time but am planning to go back and get a $5.99 frozen marg!

gDXQCQlRYrOBRjF-aL0IGQ.text: This was my first time at fuzzy's. I wish I could give it between 3 and 4 stars. I was eager to try the chain because I heard it was based in Texas. I was hoping for some different flavors. Nice interior. Good service. The food was a bit pricy. My biggest disappointment was the chips. Not sure what "Fuzzy dust" is, but it is very unpleasant.

erlN4TkaPoPbgq-FfrXM5A.text: Food wasn't good. Rice and beans were cold. Ive made better tacos at home. Definitely not going back

ytO3u4t1j13riEswWxmqOw.text: NOT IMPRESSED! Fajita chicken platter with chicken soft tacos (where was the chicken?) mix-mex rice (tasty but dry) and Latin fried potatoes (over cooked and too crusty)! They don't offer plantains?!!! Will try it one more time and if it's no better than first experience, it's off the list!!

MpZCa2AvQDN3VPHBurTEhQ.text: Probably the best burrito I've ever had in my life, shredded chicken burrito is so good, so filling. A burrito and a fountain drink is only $9.50!!!! I could eat there every night it's so amazing I can't stop talking about it

vRaHvnyOW6aOr9BlNygrhg.text: This chain has over 150 locations. Fuzzy's for Mexican is like going to the Olive Garden for Italian food. Very bland and underwhelmig food. Not even worth a review of the food. The space is nice with flat screens and several tap handles so to stop by for chips and beer it's probably not bad. For a taco shop, the space is giant. There is nothing "shop" about this place. At least they didn't call it a "joint". There are several Mexican restaurants around that are so much better - La Unica, Three Amigo's, Cantina 1511, and NOBODY serves better fish tacos than Cabo. For real burrito's - the Burrito Factory on South Blvd.

AawtgntPoRa74YnvIULmAA.text: Not great not terrible. Pretty good. The ordering was fine. Young African American lady in the middle with ponytail really knew the menu items and gets an A for accuracy and speed. Good that they repeat your order back to you. The whole bar thing needs some tweaking. You get a table number and they ask you stand at bar to wait for beverages. It was Cinco de Mayo, so the craziness may be gone on a regular Saturday?  Some of the runners seemed less than helpful, being it was our first time here like so many others we overheard, we had a few questions . Our queso was served lukewarm -timing needs improvement.  Again, could have been frantic due to Cinco de Mayo. Only day 3, so will return and may update rating. Food portions are good, especially the kids meals. All under $6 and includes a drink. Although  not authentic, it is good for the price against traditional Mexican spots,  which only seem to keep rising astronomically for their products.

RsjqrACoxnYmwkpmOsSKNA.text: Love love fuzzy tacos. Everything is amazing. The nachos are my favorite you can taste the garlic sauce and it has feta and everything is better with feta.

EG3zv5e2RFBY2hcyWUL_oQ.text: Ok food, not the best. Quesadillas were big and tasted good but the tacos didn't have much flavor. Had to use the hot sauce to spice it up. And I was kinda confused about the feta cheese. Honestly I've never known feta to go on Mexican food....but ok.

m7CbLPsno26ZvrsS8FHWSw.text: Tried shredded chicken hard tacos minus raw tomato. Not too spicy, one child approved. Adults tried the tempura fish and tempura shrimp hard tacos. Not bad, the tempura fish was Meh, the tempura shrimp was the most flavorful.  Strawberry frozen lemonade was refreshing if a bit overly sweet. The Meh to bad was the Churro experience. We bought an order of each, Oreo and Cinnamon & Sugar. The initial taste was normal, but there was a very  strange and unpleasant lingering after-taste. 10 minutes later and the aftertaste is still noticeable in the back of throat/tonsil area. Called the store and management was very apologetic and quick to offer gratis replacement on our next visit. After inquiring, management stated that the Churros are fried in a different fryer than the seafood. Not sure if we will be back for a second try. The Breakfast all day menu looks very tempting.

ngQQA6JMJuWKDvONFADZUQ.text: Boring food.  Wife and went for lunch. Service was excellent and the food brought out immediately.   Lots of TV's and drink options.  Reminded me of New Orleans with all the frozen drink machines they have.   The food was lacking, not bad, just glorified bar food.  The tacos needed flavor.  Fresh ingredients or even just a wedge of lime for some acid.   The Latin Potatoes were home fries and nothing more.  Nothing Latin at all about them. The Black Beans has some pico added, but still tasted like they were fresh from a can.  It's a bar that serves Mexican food, nothing special.  They do have good house brand hot sauces.

TQ-8P8LbteNWSIPn4JmE4w.text: Their food is inconsistent and their sweet tea is gross. Their staff is very friendly and helpful and they will bend over backward to fix any issues. I really enjoy the spicy pork with the garlic sauce, the potatos were pretty good too, can't get enough of the queso. The churros were bland and their beans pretty gross.  The overall restaurant was very clean and shiny and new, but the floor in the dining area was slick like an ice skating rink , be careful. Also I have ordered the same exact thing 3 different times and it was significantly different each time. Also my husbands tacos were not what he ordered either. It's like a really fun game of taco roulette, you order at the counter , but you never know what may end up at your table.

p8x3lyLdzwYPzaSWj3oGGQ.text: I'm torn between 2 and 3 stars. Staff is fast and friendly. The food is just very mediocre...pretty salty and lacking depth of flavor. Guacamole was watery and bland, and the chips were coated in a salty seasoning (why??). I certainly wasn't expecting authentic Mexican fare, but I can't think of any way to describe the style. The combo of feta cheese and a mayo-based sauce on every taco is odd. I would not visit again.

1BUyCKv8QeOIdxtAGq_nug.text: Ordered nachos, Chips  + Queso, and wasted my $$$. Queso & Chips were wet and floppy. Nachos were the same and drenched in horrible blue cheese.

49HEeUsNF90v5Q0kD_dNBQ.text: Went for lunch because they were just opening and we wanted to try them out.  BAD IDEA.  The tacos were super greasy and bland.  The cheese they put on it was flat and didn't offer any taste either.  The rice was dry and why would you offer fried potatoes with tacos???   It was not good.  It was clean and the people seemed friendly but the tacos need help.

FHOzC_5JwlNyIyCMhtwwYA.text: Went in today and was served raw fish (I'm pregnant by the way). They took it back and re fried it after i had touched it,  which is against food safety standards.  Long story short i got food poisoning to the point where i was dehydrated. I filed a complaint and the GM called me. He said sorry, but didn't offer any compensation what so ever.  This meal is going to cost me about $300 in medical bills and he couldn't even comp my meal. This is not the only issue i have had with them just the most critical. I have actually never gotten an order brought out to me that was correct, and i have not modified anything from their menu,  they just don't know their own menu.  Their staff is untrained and extremely terrible at customer service.   Iwish icould give them 0 stars.... well their tropical tea is good so iguess that's worth a star.

G6wilNb74_kT9KVj4vUu_A.text: Was in the area when I saw there signage. I've been seeing them pop on as a sponsored ad on Facebook so I figure what the heck let's give it a try. I'll give them this the menu is more extensive than a Chipotle or Qdoba and they seem to have daily specials as the young lady who took my order did recommend the half priced nachos. I decided to order 2 types of tacos (Ground beef, Pork). I'm not a fan of what Sabor calls "Americano Style" tacos (ie. cheese, lettuce, tomato etc) so I get them with cilantro and onion as God intended. First thing I notice is these things seemed kid size no more than 2 bites each. They weren't even especially warm considered I ordered and waited there for them to be ready (came out quick, maybe should've taken a min to heat them up).Only now reading a review of someone's kid chowed down on more than 2 or 3 to get full, my mistake I guess. But the tacos were blah at best. Nothing I'll be returning for, especially in Charlotte's crowded Mexican cuisine market. Maybe if I lived directly next door and even than I think I saw a Qdoba nearby I'd hit up first. If your in the Matthews area, El Valle in downtown Matthews is close by with far better & more authentic taste.

CT5kncRA8ljSJNT2GMfuyw.text: It's been a while since a new restaurant has exceeded all of my expectation. The food is superb, the service is friendly and FAST! And the prices are quite reasonable. Can't wait to work our way through this menu because we will DEFINITELY be back.

YsPAkPvyE0QdWXoLGzMfMw.text: I was looking forward to trying Fuzzy's and came away a little disappointed! Our food took 22 minutes to arrive, was bland in flavor and small portions. I ordered a breakfast entree that was under seasoned and looked like a mixed up dog food hash.  Maybe I'll try their Tacos next time and request extra seasoning.

5SBYGrRmPbkOGJkPc5K5QQ.text: Fuzzy's delivers on the expectation. Food is solid and drinks are great. I do wish there was patio seating.

-Ow-r-TSQ9xhLDQwvX8tTw.text: Phenomenal dining experience!  Highly recommend Fuzzy's Taco Shop.  Start to finish .... the meal was exceptional!!  The staff was truly above average in customer service and Scott was the most tentative, friendliest and most helpful throughout our dining experience.  Customer Service ranks off the charts!  Can't wait to return for another exceptional meal, delicious food and outstanding customer service.  Keep up the great work!

xPMwNCtEWy7L5qDBgp5doQ.text: Oh how I wanted to give my beloved Fuzzy's five stars. But they lose one star for the inconsistency of their salads, my favorite dish. Sometimes they are robust and filling, while at other times they feel like little more than a side salad to accompany an entree. But the taste is still there. Douse it in Fuzzy Sauce and enjoy!

nA29-1pCRydYWC7Q2_bbhg.text: We tried Fuzzy Taco Shop this past Friday. The interior is bright and fun. I was surprised to see fish and shrimp options on the menu. I had grilled fish taco and tempura shrimp taco. Both were in a soft corn tortilla and they were delicious. My husband loved his shredded pork burrito with bacon on it. My daughter raved about her chicken taco but the rice that came with it was very bland. The chips and queso are only okay. The Oreo churros were so very good. We will visit again!

Hr4KJXJze7ghrwcURYO_AA.text: We went for lunch. We had a brisket burrito and California heat tacos on flour tortilla. It was great. I really like the borracho beans. It was a lot of food for the price.

d-24dYzucVm9CgzHtFRc3g.text: Incredible brisket quesadilla, even better drinks! Environment is welcoming and friendly and a very short wait for food after ordering. Was checked on to make sure everything was great and didn't kick us out even as it neared closing time. Definitely recommend to anyone visiting the area!

kFtcPZSoOjh5Ugo3z3D68Q.text: Tacos are super greesy and I ordered a veggie one. It was dripping in oil.  Also I am sensitive to dairy and asked for no cheese. Eventhough my recipe reflected my request, it was as if no one actually looked at it.  My taco was covered in cheese.   Accidents happen so I had no issues with the mistake it was how their error was handled that was unacceptable.   They acted like I inconvenienced them by asking for a taco made the way I ordered.  The cashier literly took the taco and walked away without even telling me what they were doing.  I stood there and waited then finally asked what was going on and was informed the manager was handling it.  The manager just handed me a refunded receipt.  No apology,  nothing for their error.  Needless to say, my family will not be returning.  Food wasn't good enough to have poor service top it off.

VcJ2e8SrjE28kCamg29KhA.text: Don't waste your money. We love tacos and anything related. This place has a lot of work to do. We ordered the jalapeno bottle caps and chicken bowls. Jalapeno bottle caps were ok, it's just breaded jalapenos. The chicken bowls were such a waste of money. My cilantro was black in spots, the chicken was old and dry and the potatoes (I added to sub rice and beans) were cold. Total waste of money and would never recommend.

qiO_44YS3bBhsG9HSIB8NA.text: Mah, this place is just very okay. Food was super quick and staff was friendly enough but the food was mediocre, small portions and bland. The salsa tasted like Pace to me.  My friend got the fajita bowl and was underwhelmed with the Quality and quantity. He left hungry. My taco salad was served in a big bowl, but not memorable.  I'd say skip this place.

fQjlrM29GNdQ6KWEtiPONw.text: Awesome New restaurant in Matthews. Great food! Great prices! The grilled shrimp tacos are awesome!  Really enjoy the chorizo queso and nachos. Always a super friendly staff.  Thanks

JdWbys8Ual65mZgP4gXUQw.text: Really mediocre Mexican food. Bland, commercial example of this type and feta cheese doesn't belong in tacos!

sxv6VV1UirVx7whJoWPMmA.text: Inexpensive taco place. You order the food at the counter and they bring the food to you. Service is quick and very friendly staff. The place is huge and even has a bar. We ordered the taco plate which included two tacos and two sides. I also ordered a bean and cheese nachos and it was huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Taco plate and Bean and cheese nachos.

N3S3quszVgv_hBqeqz7k5A.text: Great food in a great location. Went with my boyfriend and the customer service was great! We got our food quickly and it was overall a great experience. We will be back!

PNvLURbujwmrSN6xf0UBTQ.text: Best margaritas in town! My husband and I love the Fuzzy's in Colorado and we're super excited for it to be here in Matthews. Definitely have to get a margarita. My favorites are the ones with champagne. Do yourself a favor and get the chicken burrito slathered in green enchilada sauce. By far the best thing on the menu.

2R1PIS-essC3IzFvjI9grA.text: I had to stop by this new taco shop in Matthews. The space is pretty large, if you have a lot of people. I know these shops are big in Texas, I tried the Baja tacos: fajita chicken, grilled shrimp, and grilled fish. My favorite was the fajita chicken, least favorite was the grilled fish. Pretty good place for simple street tacos. Nothing really wrong with this place. Good tacos, not my favorite in the Charlotte area. But good, come try them.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

iyDwIO6MAulvH0D43rbbvg.text: Just checked this place out for the first time and I have to say it was a lot better than what I was expecting!  Wife had the spicy pork and brisket tacos and they were legit.  I had one of their burrito bowls and It was definitely better than your run of the mill  chipotle bowls.    Prices were very reasonable, we'll definitely be back.

ujAdJS4fPFgY3GFRYiYaGQ.text: So, I went to this joint and ordered a few different taco varieties. The tacos and the hot sauce tasted very good, well, on the inside, and the girl at the register was very pleasant as well. HOWEVER, and I hope Fuzzy's pays attention to this - TORTILLAS ARE SUPPOSED TO BE HEATED UP!!! You CANNOT simply grab a tortilla from the bag and use it without cooking it! DISGUSTING! I had already left, so I didn't feel like turning back. Was this just a mistake, or is it your style??? I would have really enjoyed my tacos if not for that. This place has potential, but this needs to be fixed ASAP!

221tM9iIXxg5d4pTRJ0W3A.text: Been here numerous times and always had a great experience until tonight. Husband and I both order the cilantro rice for our sides yet mine looks completely different than his and much different than it ever has. Was essentially mushy and gross. Quality and consistently control. Asked about the difference and was told "oh yours must have been sitting there and not stirred up".... seriously? Pathetic. Won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

RMyjxLnp5JeyyunPgB2dog.text: Cool place.  Very good steak salad!  My son loved his tacos and I wanted to take them.  This is an early review as it was the grand opening in Matthews.  Will go back again for sure.  Highly recommend Fuzzy's Taco Shop!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Steak salad &amp; fuzzy&#39;s Butt Burnin&#39; sauce

1HID7wUbF3WnZmULkmN-8A.text: Heeeeyyyy, who knew this place existed ??! I didn't & have lived in Mint Hill/Matthews for almost 5 years now!! Thank GOD we got a franchised taco spot! The authentic restaurants are plenty in the area but having somewhere to just grab a quick bite is literally what I've been waiting on! Fuzzy's hits the mark!! Great quality of food & flavorful! Menu options are fun && you can even buy a drink!! That's 5 stars in MY book!! You also get a free chips & queso when you register online!! No brainer..

Fn6EgfNDDcC04yTb5TZvvg.text: I have nothing but great things to say about this store!  Granted, it IS a new restaurant so they are working out the kinks, but the staff is very friendly, the food is always delicious and if by chance something isn't up to par with your food or a mistake is made a correction is made immediately by either whipping up a new meal on the house OR even giving us a gift card for the mistakes made.  The management staff here always goes above and beyond to make sure everyone has everything they need and they're very friendly. The atmosphere here is very uplifting and I will FOR SURE recommend all of my friends and family to come enjoy the delicious taco plates as well as the tasty margaritas. ;)

thIigmbDzjNurbBU8BGfIQ.text: We kindly were asked to come back and give Fuzzy's another try. I had the vegetarian soup with a nice size amount of cold sour cream and green herbs! Yum! My boyfriend got two soft tacos with ground beef and fajita style steak. I would love to see some options on wine that are more set at a house price. The atmosphere is big and open, so perfect for groups in large parties and meet ups. Every one orders at the front and they bring it to your table. Super easy for those who are visiting family and friends in the area for a relaxed basic taco experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. The vegetarian black bean soup &amp; beef taco soft shell.

z1rekKmrjZYK7h7I5DeFWg.text: My fiance had kept talking about this place so we decided to go and try it out with her dad and step mom. The food was good. Not a oh my god this is amazing food but it was pretty decent. The drinks are really good. Drinks are Fairly cheap. All the special drinks are frozen slushees so that's always good. Beer for a 18 ounce is only 4.99 which is pretty good price for a good size beer. Can't wait for this place to open in Berewick so I can go drink some good cheap drinks. I got the taco and enchilada plate. My taco is a fish taco and my enchilada is a shrimp enchilada with black beans and mix mex rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

VXqldur-PwkwHAZhnawr0w.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while now. My family and I stopped in for lunch yesterday. The restaurant has a cool look and feel to it. You go to a counter to order like you would a fast food restaurant. The menu looked nice and there was a lot of variety to choose from. My daughter chose a quesadilla on the kids menu and they were nice enough to make a chicken and cheese quesadilla for her rather than the cheeseburger quesadilla on the menu. We picked baby carrots and ranch dressing as her side. My son ordered a chicken burrito. My husband and I each ordered a fajita steak bowl. It was $30. I go to insert my credit card and immediately a screen pops up for me to tip 10%, 15% or 20%. I chose %15, assuming I'd get service other than them dropping food off at our table. I had to fix my own drinks at the soda fountain and seat myself.  Food came out shortly after. I was underwhelmed at the quantity of the bowl. Looked about the size of a lean cuisine. Needed sour cream and the fajita steak was over cooked and not tender. Tasted good other than the steak being over cooked. My daughter said, "mom, look at my carrots." There were 2. Two baby carrots. Seriously? And a whole ramekin filled up with ranch dressing for for her 2 baby carrots. I asked the food dropper offer and she said yes that was normal. Sheesh. The burrito my son ordered was fine. It appeared that it was encouraged for you to clear your own table with the trash cans and my husband began to gather and throw everything away. But I figured if I was tipping, I wasn't cleaning my own table so I left my stuff.   I'm still amazed at the two baby carrots as a side.

2NyZmpyNZ0mlPG5DDd7fUw.text: Kids wanted to try this place.  It's a bit chaotic as it is a wait in line and order and they bring it to you type of place.  But, the service is then lacking. Also, if you order a drink you have to go to the bar side and pick it up, but they don't tell you this when you order.  It's also expensive for the quality of food. I got a salad and it had iceberg and gross shredded cheddar. There are better options nearby for same or better experience.

ix9dsZfEIucaTCzsVKdfJw.text: Fuzzy's Taco Shop is a clean, fast service Restaurant.  That being said I found out about this place for hotel staff.  I was expecting to be blown away.  But it's a typical taco place nothing special about the food.  I order a nacho chicken plate and Queso cheese dip.  When you first go in you go to the register to place your order.  I got a large drink and was told each refill was a dollar which is odd if that's were your making your money then something is wrong to begin with.  Second payed with a credit card and as soon as I swiped the card asked for a tip to be added.  For what is my question I do not know if the food is going to be good or the service is spot on.  I did tip 20% for what I do not know.  The food was brought out fast but that was the last I saw of anyone no one came by to ask if it was good bad or anything.  Food bland at best.  Queso tasted straight out of the can.    Chicken had no taste no seasoning at all.  The beans where luke warm at best.  The staff was cleaning and one girl was talking to others you couldn't help hearing her anywhere you were in the account.  I wanted her to just be quite for a min.  If you want to talk find out how the customers like there food and service.  The rest seemed to be keeping busy.    So if you want ok food little taste.  Service that's fast (one and done).  This is your place. But for $17.00 I will not be back.  Taco Bell here I come!!!  Same taste same food even faster service.

Clz9v63mDu-PKFdJUs75qA.text: First time eating my food to go from here on National taco day... it was pretty good! I had to reheat it in my oven because I was running errands so it got cold but it was still tasty! Will definitely be back!

pFUoGOl9gGv9W9g7piUmJg.text: Pass. Simple. Better choices in Matthews. Table service prices with drive through service and food/drink quality.

iHrxeiAJi7A06PHsGLcbTg.text: Friendly stuff, but mediocre food. Chicken tacos were bland. Ordered the cilantro lime rice, it tasted like Cajun rice? Not very impressed, probably will not revisit.

ud6stVR3IP-PnPYYc8Jh-A.text: Yummy yummy food!!! I'm a Texas girl and I love Fuzzys!!! The Matthews Location hasn't disappointed! Friendly employees and the Rita's are amazing!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

EjvL0hGJXxGyJ39VFR226A.text: I tries the fish tacos, way too fishy!  Very gross, couldn't finish it.  Didn't taste anything like Baja !  I also had the beef tacos.  They were just ok!  Not much flavor!  My husband said his beans tasted like they came from a can.  Taco bell tastes better than this place!

jnrPiVhxJw7xMfXno9u8bg.text: I tried this place on a whim I wanted something different for dinner I found the menu to be simple enough and not overwhelming I was very pleased with the veggie tacos and the rice and bean options they give you I'm not a fan of the queso but the guacamole is good the service is super fast also by the time I sat down they brought out my food

VIZ34pFtOc4BnmSxwDsl3Q.text: Had high hopes for this being a good fast taco place, but unfortunately the 3 of us all left disappointed and hungry.  The highs of this place we noticed were the menu was large, prices to portion were good, and friendly staff. Unfortunately those couldn't make up for some of the worst Mexican food we have ever had!  I ordered the fajita beef tacos which tasted bland and had a weird cream sauce on it, the shredded chicken tacos also had a weird sweet flavor. It was so unappealing I only ate half, as for sides  I got refried beans which were worse than a can of el paso from the store. The potatoes were mushy. The chicken salad was full of fatty chicken pieces that should have been trimmed and thrown away. My wife could only eat three bites before being grossed out from it, even my 7 year old said her chicken sticks were awful. We noticed a very bitter after taste with the chicken and her churros, guessing they have burnt fryer oil. The queso was off too, with this weird seasoning on the chips that was salty, but tasted similar to old bay seasoning. All in all, I would avoid this chain if you want good tacos. It's in a huge place which I am guessing will be something else soon bc their is no way they will be profitable.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Taco chicken salad full of fat
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Kids chicken sticks with little meat

WN03YvIw6ihuxl86-Zy2Nw.text: Wasn't a fan... Wasn't horrible but was bland nothing screamed come back. ... Ordered a shrimp taco and brisket taco. Shrimp taco was the better of the two but nothing special. Wasn't impressed .

jTNtkpjkepWp_Z2J6VS8_g.text: Sadly I wanted to like this more than I did. Fuzzy's takes up a giant space, probably about twice as much as needed. You order at a counter, then go get your drink and take your number back to your table. They bring the food to you.   Then, if you're like me, you ask what about silverware, and they tell you it's by the beverages, so you have to go back and get it to start eating.   The food is ok, but not at all memorable. Selection is good. I ordered the taco plate with a shrimp on corn and chicken fajita on flour tortilla. I wasn't told until after I ordered (and asked), that my taco selections were an upcharge "of $0.50 or $1 or something." They were $1 extra each...which is odd since a la carte they are $0.50 extra each.   When the food came out, I received two shrimp tacos on corn tortillas.  The food needed seasoning, and the hot sauce was not very hot.   Next time if I'm in the mood for tacos, I'd probably do El Valle or Qdoba (if I'm hungry) for better quality and price.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Two taco plate, one of the tacos was not at all what I ordered.

szj9JJNrVRzUTDAeoq493Q.text: Fuzzy's knows what it is and is successful in what it does. Relatively inexpensive Tex-Mex in a fun environment. I had the combination plate with a brisket taco, beef enchilada, mex-tex rice and charro beans. The taco was the best followed closely by the enchilada, rice and finally beans. The beans were a little bland but I corrected that with the hot sauces provided on each table. My wife had one fish and one shrimp taco. She enjoyed the fish but thought the shrimp taco was dry. I would suggest some sort of chipotle crema to improve the shrimp. The also have several kids menu options that are sure to please a picky eater. Ultimately my favorite part about Fuzzy's was the drink selection. There's something for everyone including mixed drinks, bottles and cans and my favorite, draft beer.  Some more minor criticisms include the fact that when you order chips and queso it doesn't come with salsa. This has to be asked for separately. Also, it would be nice if they started offering drink specials for different days of the week. Changing those small factors would easily increase my rating to 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

7HBofe4537jdJFzOAjN9nw.text: I kept hearing this place was opening I was very excited to try it with my friends. It did not disappoint great food, great service.  The menu has something for everyone kids an all. I ordered the grilled shrimp quesadilla an queso  dip with ground beef.  That was the best shrimp cooked perfectly not over done an the dip an chips couldn't get enough:) my friend ordered the burrito an guacamole she said both were great. They also have frozen drinks alcoholic an Non.  I will be back if your craving mexican an your in matthews make sure you stop :)

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Queso with ground beef
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Shrimp Quesadilla
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Seasoned chips

_AU3wSxY4zxAEQ6CESyvzw.text: I'm obsessed and addicted to their food. It's delicious.  I always get the veggie quesadilla and it hits the spot every single time

p-15kVCzcSUG6NHN_-z1hg.text: First off, food was very good. Lots of flavor.   However, the portion seemed pretty small compared to what I was seeing on yelp reviews. I attached both for comparison. For the price I expected a little more food.   If the portion size gets better, I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

f1AmYEonh7ch_CB1aGsuzw.text: Addicting! If I could eat here every day I would. Yummy yummy and the frozen margaritas are a great bonus. This place should have 5 stars total. Staff rocks too!

cEaiom92219nirZtNCX3Hg.text: The shrimp quesadilla is the bomb! This is our first visit but we will be back soon! The staff was so friendly and nice!  Can't wait to see you guys in Strawberry Hill!

PQHzEDtEZR-TEd3QQbNbdg.text: I was not impressed. I think it's challenging to mess up tacos, but the flavor from these tacos was lacking. I had the taco plate, which is two tacos of your choice, 2 sides, and a drink. Maybe the drink was separate, I'm not sure. I also got churros. Either way, the tacos tasted bland, and they were small. The sides I opted for were cilantro lime rice and fried potatoes of some sort. I've had some amazing cilantro lime rice before, and this was not it. This rice was void of flavor. The potatoes looked and tasted like they had been sitting under a heat lamp for a long time. Gross. The churros were hard on each end and were also lacking in flavor. They tasted like cardboard with sugar on it. The portion size of the churros was great. Too bad they tasted like cardboard. I really wanted some delicious churros. This place has very tasty unsweetened mango tea. I won't be returning. I really wanted this place to be all I had heard it would be.   Update: the manager reached out to me regarding my review and experience. I tried Fuzzy Taco again, and this time, the manager's presence was strong within the restaurant. He was monitoring and checking everything to ensure the best experience for his guests. The food was so much better! I will eat there again after this second experience! Try this place...they've improved significantly in a short period of time. Bravo!

KhmB0vNx1c4fWqHfzejkCQ.text: Waahhhh. I wanted to like Fuzzy's so much more than I did. I have plenty of friends from Texas who are real devotees of this place. After eating the food I'm not sure why. I'm guessing people love this place out of familiarity, not flavor.   The positives (and there are a lot): the interior is really great - bright, clean and plenty of space, the staff was really friendly and helpful, the drink cups are large, the food came out lightening quick and some of the food (the brisket and the lime rice were good).   The negatives:  ** The queso does not taste like it contains any actual queso. It doesn't even taste like it contains pseudo cheese like Velveeta. It tastes like melted plastic. You just cannot have a real Tex-Mex place without decent queso. I agree with a previous person who said that even McAllisters has better queso. Even Chipotle's queso is better and that is a hard thing to say!! **The chips were only okay. The Fuzzy dust stuff (Chile powder mix?) could have used more salt and of course they would have been better warm.  **Both of our menu items (cheese enchiladas and a quesadilla) had some sort of something mixed with the cheese (I guess) that we couldn't really identify. It was pretty okay in the quesadilla, it was not good in the enchilada.   I'd love to say that with a few tweaks this place would be really good, but seeing as how they are a franchise, I doubt they will be changing that queso any time soon. :(

Nmia5FCY5_RaMvvQT4vLxA.text: Love It!  Awesome Taco shop, and near our home so that is a big plus.  The fish & shrimp tacos are delish.  The chicken burrito bowl was great.  And the churros were fresh and served warm.  They have margaritas, frozen drinks, & beer on draft.  And make sure to try the hot sauce, Butt Burnin', it was a must to buy a bottle of the Habanero and take it home.  We will be regulars! (follow me on Instagram or Facebook @ #foodievida).

hc2nwE9vjcE2GHCKcNmG9g.text: Super disappointed!  We ordered chicken nachos that was covered in "queso", which had no flavor at all.  We couldn't find the chicken. As well as chicken tacos that consisted of mostly iceberg lettuce and a thin smear of shredded chicken that appeared to be cooked in a dishwasher.  We had high hopes for this place but obviously will not be returning.  Thankful we were able to get our meal refunded.

1yjZkzMd1J2aD8HXMeDPhA.text: My husband has been talking about the "Fuzzy's Taco Shop" since they opened. I'm not a huge fan of going out to eat because I seem to be able to cook better at home. It's a lot of work to constantly be cooking at home especially for those who work a lot like we do. The food wasn't "mind blowing". I ordered the breakfast burrito with chorizo. It was all very bland. Not really seasoned and the potatoes were my least favorite in the burrito. My husband ordered 2 shrimp tacos and 2 fish tacos. Was not really impressed. The atmosphere was nice and the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming.

XsXpojrrt2k_wNsqWsIGaw.text: This place is in an unfortunate spot. I have lived here for 18 years and have never seen a restaurant last here. Saying that the interior is pretty cool. It gives off kind of a tex mex sports bar theme. Unfortunately the food doesn't meet the quality of the space.   When you come in you are wow'd by the atmosphere of the place. It wasn't busy at all and yet they had MORE people than necessary working but they didn't seem like they were doing anything. Which means that all those extra hands not doing anything are costing the owners money. They cashiers seem nice. I was there with some guys from our company and so I gave my order and that was about it.   We got our drinks, sat down, and 3-4 minutes later a chips and queso came out. Probably the most disgusting chips and queso I have ever had. Especially for a place that is supposed to be tex mex good queso needs to be a must. Literally tasted like it came straight out of a can. McAllister's has much better queso and they don't even do tex mex.   Then the food came out. I ordered the fajita chicken burrito bowl. The presentation literally looked like it was just slopped together. It felt like a burrito soup because when I dug underneath everything on top to find the chicken it was wet rice and beans. I am pretty sure there was a bad piece of meat in there because I bit into a piece of chicken and it was really chewy which isnt good.   The reason why I am giving two stars is because their was actually a girl that came up and checked on us and cleared our trays and asked if she could get us anything else. Unfortunately that is not going to keep this restaurant alive. Everyone at our table agreed we probably wont be returning because the food just was not good. We could go to Chipotle or Qdoba if we want average to below average tex mex.

yJL74TWfysJdBm_ISdvQYg.text: Stop in for lunch and had their shrimp quesadilla. It was the best I ever had. Lunch special prices are excellent. They had different frozen margaritas that I want to try, once I go back.

4KzjjxhUfWkaS46MqUJ8Mw.text: Had read an article about this restaurant and it made me eager to try it.  I was expecting something a little more authentic Mexican, something significantly different than Chuey's or Moe's or Chipotle.   Well, the verdict is that it was basically the same old same old.  It was an order at the counter place where you take the number to the table and wait for the food.  Whatever.  They DID have a bar with a lot of beer on draft and a lot of pre-made frozen margaritas spinning around in the machines.  The atmosphere was bright and lively, a bit like Chuey's.   My impression is that this would be a great place for a family with kids who are looking for a fun atmosphere and are not discriminating with their food.  I had a fajita chicken burrito bowl that was served in a disposable cardboard bowl.   There was nothing special going on in that bowl. The beans and rice were luke warm, as was the chicken.  The salsa on top was just so so.  If I were a teacher and had to give a grade, it would be a C.   Oh, this looks and feels just like a chain restaurant.  If you like chains and Tex Mex, this may be your place.  For me, not so much.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

_gjeS0_tj0Nca4aOA5ZhbQ.text: I love this place for a quick bite! The queso is great to start with and comes out almost immediately. It's topped with a nice pico de Gallo garnish with some warm seasoned chips. The tacos are my favorite I usually go with chicken or fried shrimp and do the combo with two sides. I really like the corn and the cilantro lime rice. I am a pre-service teacher and I have a reusable 10% off coupon that the manager is always happy to take off of my meal for me! The staff is always friendly and prompt as well

GtqMblpV1koP91Ib6uG_Bw.text: It's taken awhile but I finally had a breakfast burrito from Fuzzy. It is large and filling and very good. I had the shrimp and eggs  I would have like a few more shrimp and have them spread out better. They all seemed to be at one end. It also could have used a little heat,  hot sauce that is. It was a pickup so next. Time I will know.  And there will be a next time. Maybe tacos.

tE1s-L8eBDPOv3oP76e9Aw.text: BEST TACOS EVER! i havent actually eaten inside of the restaurant before, ive only ever had take out that other people have brought me but seriously the shrimp tacos with the garlic sauce and cilantro and everything are the best tacos ive ever had. and this is coming from someone who's favorite food is tacos. i hope fuzzy's expands, because im gonna miss it when i movie from charlotte all the way to buffalo new york.

tDwNEvPTfbamiJGYSAcIKQ.text: New place in Lakeland. Looks nice inside. Loud atmosphere. Difficult to carry a conversation without yelling at each other. Bartender was our first contact. Ordered margaritas. Tasted like flavored water. She was rude too.  Then we got another bartender who was very good. Thank goodness! Food tasted good. We had tacos and burritos.  The food portions seem small compared to other local restaurants like Tiajuana Flats and Abuelo's. Minus one star for loudness. Minus two stars for first rude bartender and bad margaritas. Minus one star for small food portions.

Zw2HnCNpn2-MOrn2PMjaVg.text: Great looking place  Waitress was very nice. Food tasted very fresh. You will need a doggie bag. Would come back..

uAdxL7VZ9CiK21VFQD91kQ.text: I have never heard of Fuzzy's prior to relocating to Charlotte from up North. I stumbled across an IG post about a grand opening and free tacos for a year. Who says no to that??   I ended up going to one grand opening and being in the top 20 (no free tacos). Then I ended up going to another and ended up being in the top 10! Free tacos for me and my babe.   We go almost every week. This location is our favorite. The staff remembers us and always comes to check on us when we dine in. Super hospitable! There is actually another location closer but we don't like it there and drive the extra 10mins out here. No matter what part of CLT we're in, we come to this location.   It doesn't get too busy and the food is always hot and fresh. Please come check them out. Their shrimp tempura tacos are superb with some hot sauce!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Taco Plates and $2 Margarotas today!!

8bJ5dV2HLTFSXA5u2TZEdg.text: It was my first time trying Fuzzy's. I wanted to like it. The decor is fun and bright. The space is open. The menu boards are bright and easy to read.  I was trying to be healthy, so I ordered the Big Bowl Salad with steak and fire roasted salsa for dressing.  When it arrived I was surprised the bowl was an adequate size (not sure I'd call it big), but the salad itself was small. The bowl was about half full.  I asked the person who handed me the food if this was correct, and she said the bowl used to be bigger but people complained the bowl made the salad look to small.  I told her it still seemed to be a problem.  The manager came by later to ask me about my food, and I asked her the same thing. She gave me the same answer.  She offered to bring me more lettuce.  I didn't want just more lettuce. I told her if they market it as a big bowl salad, the salad needed to be big and not just the bowl.  She said she'd tell corporate.    The salad itself was ok.  Fresh ingredients but nothing special. The steak tasted fine too.  The salsa was a little bit sweet and not very fire roasted.   I wish I'd taken a picture, but I see other pictures of their salads on here. Mine looked the same. Half full.  Disappointing.

giWcBLVzpxhLLjVDna2XAg.text: I'm sorry to have to do this, but calling this place a taco shop is tantamount to calling Chuckecheese a pizza parlor.    We ate here on Saturday, March 2nd at the request of a friend (whose birthday it was) whose kids wanted tacos.    My husband and I each ordered a two taco platter... His order was correct, mine was completely wrong.  They took mine back, and replaced it with the right order.  The tacos were barely flavored with anything at all.   They were flour tortillas, cold cheddar cheese, shredded iceburg lettuce, and a few shrimp.  The only sauces on offer were called 'butt burning', the bottles on our table were sticky, and the sauce smelled like turpentine... so I passed on sauce.  The black beans were cold.  I could go on, but why bother?  The 'full bar' consisted of several margarita machines.  All were frozen concoctions of syrup and liquor.  There was no option for anything on the rocks or made fresh.  I had a beer.  This place is cheap and has cheap food.  If you like flavorless food and your kids are so picky that this is the level of blandness required, great.  Otherwise, find another taco place!

cRVU2oTDQPV4NzTQ4vTZ4A.text: Yuck! Mahi Taco was overly fishy, shrimp taco was overly salty. Refried beans and potatoes were cold. Won't be back. Taco Bell is superior to this cr

wS8q2lS1w6z7Ccnvk8lHJQ.text: Update on my review. I still think the food is ok. Nothing to write home about. I got three different tacos- veggie, fish, and shrimp. They all tasted exactly the same. The seasoning is all the same. So you wouldn't even know the difference the different tacos other than texture.  Positive note: they have an amazing frozen drink selection. They have a great special on mondays for 12oz margaritas for $2.99

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

ttNb0todf5vYCrf3dfk_Xg.text: My fiance and I stopped in while running errands the other day and really enjoyed our food. I ordered a grilled shrimp and fajita chicken taco. The grilled shrimp was really good, but the fajita chicken just tasted like a normal chicken taco - nothing special. He got a burrito bowl that was good. The staff were all very friendly and there was ample seating. Our food came out quick. They serve beer and mixed drinks, but we didn't get any. And they had signs for their daily food and drink specials. Overall I really liked it here and would come back for a quick lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Shrimp taco and chicken fajita taco
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Burrito bowl

Pca65ZEX8Qr1EATanTwUfw.text: Do you like food that barely looks like food? Do you enjoy repeating your order three times to the person taking it? Should it matter that three employees are standing there acting a fool while you repeat "chips and queso" another time?  If you answered yes, RUN to this horrendously brightly lit and loud disaster of a place. They are going to hook you up with a foiled mess just like this one.   Was it soggy? Yes.  Did it taste good? No.  Maybe it's called Fuzzy's because that's the condition your brain needs to be to consider eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. This is supposed to be a fish taco.

PXRmJ3-PakExhjqUL28Pgg.text: This place is amazing! The inside is vibrant and very colorful. It's a huge establishment  so there was plenty of seating. The menu is  extensive but very easy to follow.   I ordered the 2 taco platter. It came with 2 sides. I believe it was $7.99 which I think is a good deal. The food came out super fast. Everything was delicious, including the pinto beans that were cooked in beer and bacon!!! The food was so good, I wanted to bring my husband back later on that night for dinner lol. I am what one may call a taco snob but this food was delicious and the service was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Absolutely amaxing!

aoKpc8SjnfGE7Gnp0d_JlA.text: We tried Fuzzy's for lunch and had a chicken fajita burrito bowl and a taco plate (with rice & refried beans) + a side of chips (just a buck). Our food came out really fast, but overall it was just okay. Nothing was bad, but we were underwhelmed in general--being a chain from Texas, I had higher hopes. For a quick taco spot, I'd much rather go to Sabor.   We liked the atmosphere and decor (like someone else mentioned, it reminded me of Chuy's) and the staff was super friendly and willing to answer our questions while ordering. Will give them another shot since it's so close to home & they have schooners!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. 18 oz schooner

SPeV7LFqA9IlDpcrlbQ59w.text: Fuzzy Taco is a nice , chill, inexpensive taco shop . If you're looking for the basic dishes , no frills with a casual environment this is your spot .   Perks: -TVs , like most wing spots you can catch sports here while eating tacos ... smart .  -Food: simple , tacos , burrito bowls , salads , quesilldias, kids menu , etc. Etc. The menu was vast .  ----We ordered the burrito bowls at 8.95 , the two taco plate with refried beans , and potatoes , and the kids quesilldia with cinnamon churros . All had flavor and all was satisfying for my family of 4 , at only $32 . Not bad and 10times cheaper than chipotle. There was fresh cilantro and guac on our bowls .  There's an option of corn/ flour tortillas , or hard shell .  -Service , they are quick with food prep and they bring your meals out to you as well as clean the tables all with a cheerful attitude .   We will definitely visit again when we're craving  a simple , yet flavorful taco ...

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Kids cheeseburger quesilldias
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Chicken tacos with potatoes and beans
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Chicken burrito bowl

_p__6QOu9s862aWmlVyy2w.text: Fuzzy's has replaced Amor de Brazil in Syacmore Commons, which means that they have a rather large space to fill - and that by many definitions they are perhaps not a "shop", but rather a full-blown "restaurant'. This is perhaps being a bit particular, but as they just opened, it becomes important.   At least on their first night of business, they were seeing a brisk crowd - in fact, for most of the places in this strip, it would be a ton of business - but because of the sheer size of the location, it really wasn't full. Unfortunately, due to a lack of training, unclear registers or some other reason, just having a line two people long to order tacos took way longer than it should have.  The good news is that once you get through the ordering process itself, there were plenty of seats available, the rest of the staff was ready and waiting to help - lots of them wandering around and clearing off unused items and making sure that the visit was good, and once the food came up it didn't take long to deliver to the table (you are given one of those numbers that you stick on your table so they know where to send it once it is ready).  As to the food? It's reasonable enough, and you can come out full for a few dollars, probably less than you will spend at most Mexican restaurants, but there are other, more authentic places around if you look closely enough. Many of the tacos we tried - and we tried several of them - didn't have much flavor, and even add the "Butt Burnin" sauce didn't help a whole lot (and my butt wasn't burnin', either - so the advertising wasn't really telling the truth, either!).  Regardless, it was their first night, so here is to hoping that things improve.

LxDw1pC-J7WWLt3Gg42wtA.text: Great food at an affordable price. This place is definitely worth checking out. About 8 different choices of tacos. The fishbowl margaritas are great and the caronaritas and awesome as well, otherwise they have about 10 beers on draft. I love stopping by fuzzies for an affordable Mexican meal

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Bar
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Counter
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Dining area

ikEIGT27Uybj0ypc93oK-Q.text: This place is incredible. The food and drinks are great. They have locations in Dallas Texas...  So excited they are In Charlotte  Come eat here great place

OhF9hVS5KgYnM9R7v3E5hw.text: I wanted to like this place but the salsa tasted like and has the consistency of spaghetti sauce. Not impressed.

svfsBNN0zz1rxldmB_YKoQ.text: When two chefs who both happen to be mystery shoppers go out to eat, what do you think happens???  We never really escape from that mode unless the place is really special.  There's a few special places in the downtown Matthews vicinity but this isn't really one of them.  I always go to some place new with an open mind and really don't let the fact that a specific business location has never really hosted any successful restaurant, how many restaurants have been in that spot??  Positive and fun atmosphere and wide open space.  I liked how clean it was, the cashier was very friendly and efficient, the table tops were slick and dry, like we were the first to ever sit there and the mango tea was exquisite!!!  Other people's Margaritas looked amazing!!  I felt that our two taco dishes were petit and small, each taco being about two man-bites.  My son needed two additional tacos for a total of four to be full. I could have eaten 5 however I shoved myself into my skinny jeans and just couldn't manage to eat more than two. Ugh!  I didn't like the Hot Sauce at all and after reading the second ingredient was KETCHUP, was disappointed (you have to bring your own hot sauce) to a taco restaurant, really???  The yellow rice was excellent and had good flavors but the white rice was under cooked and firm.  Nothing was served piping hot except the freshly fried potatoes which they forgot to put on our plates.  To rectify this, they brought us complementary Churros!!!  Yeah, so the best way to heat up these churros which come in already made, I buy them too) is in a hot dry oven and then they can be cut up and tossed into cinnamon sugar.  What y'all do - is cut them up and then deep fry those little sponges which suck up the grease (they're already cooked).  Then, they were tossed with cinnamon sugar which had a cayenne background flavor as if the two spices crossed paths inadvertently during some period of service.  As soon as we all bit into them, the fry grease was released like that chewing gum from the 80's called "Freshen-UP" The gum that squirts!!!  My wife's salad entree was also petit and served in a giant bowl which only made the portion appear smaller and seemed to be lacking in salad ingredients. The avocado ranch dressing however is quite yummy and we even took some home!!!  Maybe as a group of drunken friends going out for a casual bite it's okay but as an eatery to frequent, not so much.  "Eat Me" being part of their logo just made me keep thinking about vulgarities!!  After discussing this at home, we both felt the same way!!!  Inconsistency will be their downfall.

R7qepTleX1_Gkab87llqOg.text: First time trying out this place, place is nice and clean, friendly servers I ordered crispy fish taco and love the crunchiness the taco sauce works with it, cilantro lime rice is good refried beans is alright. I'll be back to try the Breakfast menu and jumbo burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Fish grilled and tempura Taco
Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States. Cilantro lime rice, refried beans

oMOElD_OzqYn4vYoHL6C6Q.text: Landed here as Kabab Je was not open because of the weather (great middle eastern food!) I wish I stayed home. Service was fair, after they ran our food out to the wrong table. The single guy who got our food (two of us) didn't say anything. He ate my burrito even though he ordered something different.  When the staff noticed us sitting there without food they did rectify the situation and brought fresh orders to our table.  Food, less than par. Service the same. Managment did send out an order of chips and cheese, but we had already had the nachos. Good effort to rectify, but not sure we're heading back anytime soon.

DBPwpbXr5EKY_ttlEUHUfw.text: Tacos were GREAT !! The mex rice is my favorite I got fajita chicken n fajita beef tacos refried beans and $3 margaritas everything was good and affordable so many different options the whole staff was super nice .... I will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Fuzzy's Taco Shop - Matthews, NC, United States

CKxviGyhE-TJnV6AJydXhg.text: We're frequent visitors of Fuzzy's which helps when you have one free taco plate a year! We love their frozen drinks with the mini Coronas and mini champagne bottles in them and usually order at least one with each visit. Their queso is good and comes with some tomatoes and cheese sprinkled on top with dusted chips. I usually get the taco plate and my favorite are the breakfast tacos with bacon or chorizo with the Latin fried potatoes on the side. We've also ordered the burrito before and I highly recommend getting it smothered so it comes covered in queso! Our food always comes out quickly and hot here, my only qualm is that we always sit at the bar (there's full service there) but the bartender is always different. They must go through staff quickly here because I think we've only had the same bartender twice which means there's always a learning curve with the new staff members.

BWaMG6zD_Xx-nJy7B58NGA.text: Been here a few times and love their frozen margaritas.  They have beer, wine and other tasty beverages.  The food is ok.  The staff are always friendly and attentive.

-yjpmmODPoDg-v7WKi9gIg.text: Fuzzy's taco shop! My husband and I went there to have dinner, I had the taco plate, it was absolutely delicious. I ordered refried beans, but they brought regular black beans. I asked the lady if that was just regular black beans or refried beans and she said,  "well it's regular black beans, did you order refried beans?" And I said, "I did but it's OK I'll try the black beans.", and she was so apologetic she said "oh no that's OK, are you sure?" And I said, "it's really OK, I am happy to try the black beans since I haven't been here before." And we got our food right away, we got a regular margarita and it was delicious, it was so good. The prices are amazing and the food is so delicious and so fresh; meanwhile the waitress came back and brought me a free refried bean dish to try because she felt bad. She was very apologetic and went above the norm.  It was so delicious and she was so nice everyone was so excited and happy to be working there and serving there.  I cannot wait to go back and I give them 6 stars.

DkDI1r8tGYAJerTwQbsA2A.text: Right off the bat one of young girls taking orders gave us a big smile and sweet hi. Not a phony welcome to CiCis hello. A genuine friendly hi. And then the girl who took our order was just as nice and very helpful. We all ordered and headed for a table. Our food was there in about 2 minutes. Great timing!  Now for the food. Finally, a restaurant not afraid to use some spice. Not too much, but really favorable. And the folks cleaning up were right there, clearing as we went. This was a great first experience.
